@Holiday_Jenkins @2020Lightning Many HS coaches do not plan to participate. Some coaches use the summer for their families. I guess there is some good points for it but I donâ€™t see it.
@Holiday_Jenkins @2020Lightning Lots of pressure on children to perform in just 2 events. I think new rules are horrible.
@Brotherhood05 Career 9-7-5 guy. Plays on a all time great team and is probably the best defender. Maybe not HOF but most coaches love a glue guy like him.
@Holiday_Jenkins @2020Lightning Right. But no college coaches are going to see weak HS teams unless a specific kid is already on radar.
@Holiday_Jenkins @2020Lightning Hurts kids that weâ€™re not on the radar by their Jr year. Hurts kids who play on weak HS teams.
Biggest FACT of the day! https://t.co/PofHmvtpf8

@lenny_phil @therealzanetta Iâ€™m sure Trumps 2020 campaign will put her on payroll at 10k a month just to ensure her silence. Quite a few ppl who have left admin are on that payroll. We heard on tape them offering it to Omarossa.

@AAUParentfacts you cannot tell what a kid will do over a 35 game AAU season from just 2 2 hour practices. We can think it, we can hope but at the end of the day I am guessing most coaches get it right but it is not an exact science. We all miss. Sometimes you cut a kid that is really good.

@AAUParentfacts It's hard to know from a 3 hour try out. And sometimes a kid just doesn't perform to the level of where you thought they would be. Lot's of intangibles. Or a kid playing in front of them is just flat out better.
Happy Bday Fella!!!!! https://t.co/ECx6f21G6M

@boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @BallasTV Yeah, im about done with this convo. facts dont matter. he is arguing on gut feeling. I dont like Jay Wright. But i dam sure respect the eff outta his coaching ability.

@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV You named 3 blue bloods. LOL. You keep setting the bar and then moving it. Who has been successful like those teams? Do you realize their are 347 D1 basketball programs. You knock him because 3 are better. Then call him average. ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚
@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV last time... I will say slowly. His career winning percentage is higher than at least 4 guys you named in your top 10.
@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV HIS CAREER WINING PERCENTAGE IS HIGHER..... Take those 4 years out and he still has more sweet 16 appearances. Geesh.
@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV Good thing Jay Wright did not lose to UMBC you might call him a bad coach.
@boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @BallasTV Roy Williams has 3 second round losses in last 6 years maybe he is not "slightly above average" either.
@boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @BallasTV Exactly. Maybe Coach K is only "slight above average" ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV How do you rank coaches? I know D3 coaches that would win chips at D1 if they had the talent. You can't just rank coaches. If you truly understand basketball.
But I would be hard pressed to find 10 coaches with Jay Wrights resume.

@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV PPl are holding 1st round losses against him like Nova was not the 9 seed in two years and got upset as a 2 seed the other year. But I guess upsets dont happen to Elite coaches.
@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV Thant 2 chips is more than 90 percent of other coaches..... ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚
@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV Bruh, I thought he was a hell of a coach when he took Hofstra to the dance. The man can actually coach.

@boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @BallasTV The reality is, if YOU were lucky enough to get a D1 gig at a non blue blood school and YOU had the exact same career Jay has had. YOU would be extremely proud of yourself. He has done what the VAST majority of college coaches have not. And for some reason u cant see it.
@boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @BallasTV no talking sense into this useless debate. Wright is slightly "above average" and under performing in the 11th game of the season.

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV Calipari has 11 years more coaching experience and Jim has like 25 years more experience.
And even then the chip is not the sole indicator of being a good/great coach.
@all_metelite Good point.

@all_metelite For the top 100 or 150 players Iâ€™m betting college coaches would rather deal with HS coaches more so than AAU sneaker team guys. Nothing is done by accident. If Iâ€™m wrong then itâ€™s another reason but it for sure ainâ€™t a mistake.
@all_metelite Itâ€™s not a mistake. They did it on purpose.

RT @ColbyGHoops: Coaches in the area:
Any stats for your players, please donâ€™t hesitate to send them so I can help make them known. DM orâ€¦

@jwherron10 I think he was borderline (1 & Done). If he had a strong year and a few big games in tourney then hell yes.... Kids love that jelly fam. Great marketing.
However, being a 20 yr old freshman, caught in the scandal in AZ and now being uncoachable is hurting him.
@ben_davis113 @TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @BallasTV Tony Bennett is a hell of a coach. Or are we now on the Tony Bennet can't coach bandwagon?

@ben_davis113 @TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @BallasTV OK. Agreed. But I am not getting your point. His resume speaks for itself. Not many out there are better. That cannot be debated. So what are we in fact debating? What is a top ten coach? Who is a top ten coach? And if his resume is not then whose is?
@ben_davis113 @TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @BallasTV Kevin Ollie was only a head coach for 6 years. The one group of 4 yr players he recruited never got past 2nd round. bad comparison.
I have not caught one of his games. But if this highlight is anything like how he plays night in and night out, then he may need consideration for the number 1 pick. https://t.co/CFuWfgyFDS
@boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @BallasTV I can't with you now
@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV Yeah, they have a tough stretch coming up against Santa Clara, CSU bakersfield and North Alabama
@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV C'mon man. You might be the only person EVER to say Brunson is one of the best college players EVER.

@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV Bruh, u just watch bball. You clearly dont understand it. Like I said Im not a Jay wright fan but if you take in the beauty of his offense you cant make those types of statements. The fluidity is amazing.

@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV There you go again. On your list of 10 coaches at least 5 of them play weaker schedules than NOVA. You have no standard for your argument. You are just bored and want attention right now. U just keep making ish up.

@boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @BallasTV Please we gotta be specific. he took a senior laden team to the tournament his first year then never had another winning season before getting fired at BC.

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV oh, "above average". Ok. So the other 300 coaches in D1 who never won a chip or have winning percentages in the low 6's or below are not even good coaches. SMH.

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV Im not a silly fan. I talk facts and love the game. The man is clearly a good coach. im actually playing myself by even debating something so obvious.

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV D1 ball is more than just 6 top level coaches. There are a few hundred programs and jay wright is clearly in the top 10-15 coaches who I would call elite. based on accomplishment.
@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV Neither did John Thompson or alot of coaches. Bruh, you are holding Jay Wright to a unattainable standard.

@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV He has made sweet 16 and final four before also. Do you realize how hard it is to accomplish the things he has? What does glossing over his win percentage mean? If you win almost 7 out of 10 NCAA D1 games in your career that is a MAJOR accomplishment.

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV LOL. Ok. Couldnt keep up. Went to the final four a year before he left for the NBA. I'm sure that is why OKC hired him cuz he couldn't keep up.
Nice talking with you.
@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV LOL. .690 career winning percentage and 2 chips is "average". Thats actually funny if you think about it.

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV Yall? wth. I love basketball. Im not even a NOVA fan. the man can coach his ass off. And he is in the midst of a great run at a non blue blood school.

@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV I stand corrected he has a .690 CAREER winning percentage. So now we are comparing him to elite coaches? Cal, Williams and Coach K. That is who you are basing your argument on. I would agree with you. They have had better careers. But that does not make him a bad coach.
@BTS_Report WHy do you think it was a stretch?

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV And Coach K and Roy were at blue blood schools. No one is saying Nova is in same category as Duke, Kansas or North Carolina. Not a fair comparison.

@TheOracleACHNJ @ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @BallasTV LMAO. Jay Wright is not an elite coach? .720 wining percentage in 23 yrs coaching at the D1 level plus 2 chips and another final four.
So if his resume is not elite than is he at least decent or good to you? or he just plain sucks?

@TheOracleACHNJ @boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @BallasTV He was coaching at Hofsta how do you expect him to win a championship there? Geesh. And he took them to the dance twice in a row. How hard can u try to diminsh over 400 wins with a over .720 winning percentage in his career. The VAST majority of GOOD coaches NEVER win one.
@ben_davis113 @boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ @BallasTV Yea, the 90's. he got his first job in 1994 at Hofsta.
@jwherron10 Some interesting stuff.

@boggio_ryan @ben_davis113 @TheOracleACHNJ @BallasTV I'm laughing my ass off. Ppl act like Jay Wright just started coaching and winning Championships. The man has been successful since the early 90's. Based on numbers alone he is in the top tier of D1 coaches. Being mad at him over a players playing time does not change that.
@BallasTV @boggio_ryan @TheOracleACHNJ Since 1994 Jay Wright has won over .700 percent of his games. Are we really going to question his coaching ability?

@__Mac___ He is a 20 yr old freshman. He is used to dominating and having things go his way. This can't be easy for him. I hope he is listening to the right group of ppl. Even if he has to do two yrs of college he can still be a high NBA pick.
